## GSEA Round 2 {#t2d2012-2}

**Last updated:** `r Sys.Date()`

**Code version:** `r system("git log -1 --format='%H'", intern = TRUE)`

### Fit the null model

From the Round 1 null analysis (Section \@ref(t2d2012-1)), I found that almost 95.3% posterior mass is concentrated on the settings `h=[0.4 0.5 0.6]` and `theta0=-4.5`. In Round 2, I used a finer grid. Specifically, I used the grids `theta0=(-4.75:0.025:-4.25)'` and `h=(0.3:0.1:0.6)'` when fitting the null model. I estimated the (unnormalized) log importance weights ("pseudo-likelihoods") for all 84 sets of `(h,theta0)` under null.

```{r,echo=FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics("images/t2d2012_null_round2.png", dpi=NA)
```

After normalizing the log "pseudo-likelihoods" (`logw.step*`) to posterior probabilities (`posp.step*`), we can see that almost 99.8% posterior mass is concentrated on the settings `h=(0.3:0.1:0.6)'` and `theta0=(-4.75:0.025:-4.35)'`.
```{r, include=FALSE}
null.path <- "~/Dropbox/rss/Data/t2d_2012/pathway/t2d2012_null_201609.mat"
null.df <- null.mat2df(null.path)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
source("src/null_dt.R")
null.dt
```

```{r}
theta0.index <- as.character(null.df$theta0) %in% as.character(seq(-4.75,-4.35,by=0.025)) 
sum(null.df$posp.step2[theta0.index]) 
```

### Fit the enrichment model

To perform GSEA, I set `h=(0.3:0.1:0.6)'` and `theta0=(-4.75:0.025:-4.35)'`, since the null analysis suggests that almost 99.8% posterior mass is placed on these settings. For the log-fold enrichment parameter, I use the grid `theta = (0:(3/60):3)'`. The following table lists the GSEA results. 
```{r, include=FALSE}
gsea.path <- "~/Dropbox/rss/Data/t2d_2012/pathway/t2d2012_pathway_201609.mat"
gsea.df <- gsea.mat2df.round2(gsea.path) 
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
source("src/gsea_dt_round2.R")
gsea.dt
```
